org.magnos.stat
Class StatDatabase

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.stat.StatDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<StatArchive>
public class StatDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<StatArchive>

A database of round robin archives which hold the summary of a statistic over time. 

 A typical format for a database that tracks data over an extended period of time:
 
 StatFormat sf = new StatFormat(5); // A format that covers a year (365.25 days)
 sf.set(0, 300205L, 12);                        // one point every 5 minutes for an hour 
 sf.set(1, 3602467L, 24);               // one point every hour for a day
 sf.set(2, 43229589L, 14);              // one point every 12 hours for a week
 sf.set(3, 86459178L, 31);              // one point every day for a month
 sf.set(4, 7606876923L, 52);            // one point for every week in a year
 sf.compile();                                  // database size = 3328 bytes

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Detail

add

public StatEvent add(float statistic)
Adds the given statistic to the database. This will add the given statistic to the StatServer which will then process the statistic by adding it to all target databases (only this one by default).

Parameters:
statistic - The statistic to add to the database.
Returns:
The event that was generated to add the statistic to this database. This has already been added to the StatService for processing but additional target databases can be added if done immediately. If the database is disabled null will be returned.

getEvent

public StatEvent getEvent(float statistic)
Returns a statistic event which will add the given statistic to this database. The returned event has not been processed and will not be added to the database until the process method is invoked. Before the event is processed however target databases can be added to the event. If the event is not processed soon enough its statistic might not make the archives with the shortest intervals.

Parameters:
statistic - The statistic to add to the database.
Returns:
The event that was generated to add the statistic to this database. If the database is disabled null will be returned.

addEvent

protected void addEvent(StatEvent event)
Adds the given event to all archives in the database.

Parameters:
event - The event to add to all archives in the database.

exists

public boolean exists()
Returns whether this database exists.

Returns:
True if the underlying store exists, otherwise false.

public StatFormat getFormat()
Returns the format of this database and its archives.

Returns:
The reference to the format which created the database.

getArchive

public StatArchive getArchive(int index)
Returns the archive at the given index. If the index is outside the bounds of the archive array an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

Parameters:
index - The index of the archive to receive.
Returns:
The reference of the archive at the given index.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the database. If the store is persisted to the filesystem this is typically a filename.

Returns:
The name of the database.

getGroup

public StatGroup getGroup()
Returns the group which holds this database.

Returns:
The group this databases exists in.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Returns whether this database can accept statistics.

Returns:
True if this database can have statistics added to it, otherwise false and statistics will not be added to the database.

setEnable

public void setEnable(boolean enabled)
Sets whether this database can accept statistics.

Parameters:
enabled - True if this database can have statistics added to it, otherwise false and statistics can not be added to the database.
